column4: Hello. I have a problem with Eclipse on Ubuntu. It runs excruciatingly slow, I can't really edit any files, b/c when I start typing I get huge pauses between response times. I'm convinced that it has something to do with Java. My computer is fast enough it's like a Pentium 1.8 w/1 GB of RAM. So it's all good there. I tried to update my Java to 1.5 via instructions on the net (http://jroller.com/page/triplem74?entry=insta
Eclipse on ubuntu is a bit slow -- but you might try downloading the gcj-compiled version of eclipse.  It should be a bit more managable
Is this java debs that nalioth is talking about?
I haven't looked at nalioth's suggestion.  Lemme poke ubotu
It works fine w/Windows XP btw.
no doubt.  Friend trying to install ubuntu_386 or ubuntu_x86_64 (or whatever the abbrev.s are)?
Gotcha.  No real experience with that distribution, but I know I shied away from it on my amd64 box.  At least when I was installing, the 64 bit port had a status of "well, it sorta works"
well, the normal 32bit distribution runs like a charm
What should he do to make the 64 bit work?
no clue.  first things I'd try are (a) check the logs for any funny business, and (b) see if you can get a foolsafe session running
Alright Managu, thanks but I think that he just gave up :)
errm, not foolsafe.  Failsafe.  I think it's my bedtime
